Character development: Ensuring that the characters are well-defined, relatable, and have clear motivations to drive the plot forward.
Plot structure: Developing a well-structured narrative that includes character arcs, subplots, and pacing to keep the audience invested in the story.
Dialogue: Crafting natural and authentic dialogue that accurately represents the characters and their relationships, as well as advancing the plot.
Screenplay formatting: Adhering to standard industry guidelines for formatting the script, including margins, font size, and style.
Budgeting: Estimating the costs associated with production, including location fees, actor salaries, and special effects, to ensure that the film can be made within budget constraints.
